direction.raw_text: I don't like the word gay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which would you prefer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ravenous homosexual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the tape, okay.  Forget it, Ellen.  Let's call security and get him out. As Aaron walks out -- Tom is momentarily fixed on the sight of Buddy walking in small circles giving himself a talking to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great time to act out, Buddy.  You won't be happy until you turn the whole world off. He notices Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not really going to call security are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I get out of here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talked me into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom distracted -- his day has been a bit of a bummer.  Buddy self conscious -- the proximity creating an almost unbearable tension of romance and adventure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guard on duty -- a BLACK WOMAN.  She sees Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're the gay guy.  I was just coming to find you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walking.  Buddy in step with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? Tom turns.  Buddy talks rather quickly -- He cares very much about leaving Tom with the right impression.  The last words of his speech he hadn't expected to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for not shunning me and all. (more) I really did have all that information but I thought I might just be being vindictive to get a little hunk of the ol' spotlight.  I know, horrible -- but I didn't do it, so okay?  And thanks again and would you like to have a drink -- at a regular bar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure.  Okay. His heart racing, Buddy attempts casual matter-of-factness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a regular bar around here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REGULAR BAR - NIGHT Tom and Buddy on adjoining stools.  For Tom, the last weeks have been humbling, antagonistic.  He's enjoying Buddy who listens attentively and wholeheartedly endorses every word Tom speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been doing some morning show stuff, but mostly radio -- that doesn't bother me.  I'm in no rush for anything.  It's just the snotty attitude, even if I have it coming, it's still...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad manners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know...I mean you didn't do anything special for me tonight.  You just had what I think are good manners, decency. And it really makes me want to be nice back and it has nothing to do with any homosexual thing. (looks right at him) Honestly. (then away) Because I don't know if you've homosexual or not and -- you're not, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One's enough. Tom signals for the check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't doing anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  At least let me show my appreciation.  The Secretary of Labor is going to be indicted on Wednesday. For the graft thing he supposedly did before he was appointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's true.  They're going to make it public Wednesday but isn't it a big deal for you to have it a day and a half early?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My roommate's very social -- somebody from Justice was over and...I always hear things before they happen.  Hey, and from now on, so do you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George Weln, the black correspondent and Tom are seated in the office with Ernie -- they are in mid-meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm virtually certain it's not true. He may be indicted eventually, but I don't think it will be this month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to be alone with me -- tell me your source?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I told you I'm not sure it would totally convince you, but I totally believe the guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Labor is my Department -- I can't conform it and my contacts go very deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if it's true -- I'm terrific, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not even a close call.  Of course we can't go with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane is working with Bobbie the editor... Snatches of the tape make it obvious that the Labor Secretary has been indicted -- George Weln stands behind Jane, who is dialing a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want him all the way to the car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No stop where he's all besieged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right there, Bobbie. Tom enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he was indicted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were right not to go with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I was right -- just somebody give it to me.  I had a good story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to him -- so we can concentrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, I don't want any credit.  Bobbie and I serve anonymously. He pats Bobbie on the back... and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I like Tom, because hi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobbie, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crowded rush hour... Buddy and Tom stand next to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and the White House is hoping to keep a lid on it for a few days till they figure out what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot, Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, please.  So they were really impressed with you at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not impressed exactly -- but a break in the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see the change in you -- I see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 10 A.M. briefing just breaking up -- Jennifer leaves her network seat in the front row, only to be grabbed by Tom who steers her outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the near distance a circular driveway and a silent armed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing at attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he bought this Peugeot sedan at a greatly reduced price while he was there in charge of the White House Advance Team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you're not chasing it down yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm junior man -- and it's your beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, that's nice...I wish we could all deal with each other like this. I'll check it.  Anything I can do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my first time at the White House. Is there any chance to look at where he works and the rest of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have the guts to ask when I first came up.  I'll get you a great tour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy and Tom watching the Evening News as Jennifer finishes her story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President says it's not a violation but nonetheless White House sources say the full price will be paid for the Peugeot and new rules will put future bargain hunting off limits for Presidential Aides.  This is Jennifer Mack at the White House. Tom and Buddy smile at each other... energized -- up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, but it really is intoxicating being a news source.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody else had it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish it were you giving the story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if we just don't tell them anything anymore unless they let you do the story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Really...don't worry about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  And look, in the future I can call you when I have news for you. Don't feel you have to spend time with me just to get the information. (a breath; then to himself) Well, that wasn't as hard to say as you thought, was it, Buddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?  You're one of the few people in this town I can talk to. Buddy puts his hand to his heart and makes a LOUD SOUND OF RAPTURE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hoooo. The BARTENDER and some nearby patrons turn and look.  Tom shifts with discomfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Buddy, don't do that anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane waiting for an elevator... It comes and she steps on just as Tom clearly excited comes around the bend from Ernie's office calling for her.  He goes to the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs out and sees Jane in the lobby below, then takes off after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he enters and runs outside, looking in both directions then running off to the right.  A BEAT -- REVEALING Jane has stopped to talk with Blair -- now she exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom on the street, ahead of her, thinking he's behind her... He runs another half a block and stops dejected... Turns to walk back to the office.  He keeps looking back to see if he missed her, so that his head is turned as Jane reaches him, says a fairly social:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, how are you? She keeps moving -- Tom spinning after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- I need you. She stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got another story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some public official skipped a week on his Christmas Club?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The House Armed Service Committee has a secret report which says that the General Stillwell tank the Army has dumped a fortune into plain won't work.  I have it cold, confirmed.  They have five million dollars in this thing already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, billion...right, of course. They told me I could have any producer I wanted -- and I want you. As Tom savors the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Various bureau personnel standing at their desks watching Tom's piece being broadcast.  We SEE a TANK MISFIRING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One source referred to it as a five billion dollar metal sculpture to ugly to look at and too big to bury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You write this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I write for you sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not because you have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We SEE a General walking away from Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: General Elton McGuire is in charge of the weapon system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TWO SHOT GENERAL I've been in the Army twenty-seven years -- so I'll let the Army ask the questions, not you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: General, I don't want to bother you anymore or your family.  But tomorrow there will be a mob of me back here -- so, if you have anything to say, why not say it now, sir, the way you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a study. Looking at himself -- and though it's far from his first time on television -- it's the first time he's seen himself doing serious work and, by all appearances, doing it well.  As the General answers in the b.g. -- BLAIR I think it's great of us to have left in what you said -- just great of us. Tom smiles modestly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, let's never forget.  We're the real story.  Not them. Tom and Jane look over -- then Tom looks to Jane for a verdict. In the b.g., the news goes to a commercial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know, I went back and forth on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I liked it.  He's not afraid to be human. Ernie ENTERS THE SCENE with his fourteen-year-old DAUGHTER in tow... He approaches Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My youngest wanted to meet you. This is Ellie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Ellie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be honored -- she never cares about meeting anyone here.  But she liked you on television just now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Ellie -- remember me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry -- from where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been to your house a lot...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Aaron went on that fourteen day raft trip with us last year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes -- hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Dad...Did you see it?  Great -- I'll send you a tape...I'm sorry I haven't called.  Things were a little bumpy for a while.  It's not important... I'm fine now. (what he's been wanting to say aloud) Hey, Dad -- I just may be able to do this job...Well, I'm glad you were sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ERNIE MARRIMAN'S VIRGINIA HOME - DAY Ernie is hosting the news staff for Sunday brunch -- they stand around drinking in small groups... Aaron is standing with Blair and a MAN in his fifties we have not seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why we have to feel defensive about it.  Newspapers are in business to make money -- why not us? Aaron looks at her in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They criticize us for supposedly pandering while they run WINGO Games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly right.  Excuse me.  I'm paid to mix. Blair and Aaron laugh appreciatively as he walks off to another group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care, Paul. (back to Blair) It takes a certain kind of courage for you to say that in front of the President of the News Division.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think anyone who's proud of the work we do is an ass kisser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I think anyone who puckers their lips and presses it against his boss' buttocks and then smooches is an ass kisser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My gosh, and for a while there, I was attracted to you. She walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute -- that changes everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the bar getting a drink. Jennifer ENTERS THE SCENE... and leads Jane down the hall until they are standing alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is very awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead -- what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ummm -- it's dumb dorm stuff but I see Tom around you a lot and this is such a small office and I'd like to see him outside of work, unless there's some reason for you to mind... in which case I just won't do anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God Almighty -- Whew.  Do I mind? Why do I mind?  I do mind.  What a shock -- I don't have a right to... I don't think I like him.  I know I don't respect him...So what am I talking about -- what am I saying to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're saying stay away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't be. She blinks in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to settle this definitively right now. Jennifer moves toward the drinking table -- Jane, unsteadied by the dose of self-revelation, moves towards Aaron's circle and scratches his back in friendship... Tom approaches an she moves off -- not wanting to deal with him.  She takes a few breaths as she keeps walking.  We HEAR snatches of PARTY CONVERSATIONS, i.e:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me one person who ever left television news to work on a newspaper. She moves on; Tom still following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt so proud when he turned down News Vice President so we could stay here.  Suddenly, after all these years, we have a life. Jane turns -- sees that Tom is still looking at her from a few feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Tom. She stands there, genuinely frightened.  She must deal with him now.  He crosses to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the firs time I've seen you dressed like this.  You look so clean and pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean clean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At work there's always this sort of film over you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thumps like me leave appearance to guys like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're great at taking the edge off a good time. Jane starts twitching.  She pauses -- holds a hand lightly on his arm to steady herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Just don't say anything mean for a while.  Thanks. She meets his gaze for an instant -- and, in that instant, loses control for the first time in her memory.  She looks strange as she retreats from this glimpse of upheaval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to find someone.  It's important.  Excuse me. She walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had the strangest thing happen yesterday.  Anne and I have been married what? -- Thirty-six years... Everything fine -- two days after the promotion came through, I was checking myself in the mirror and she was making a face at me behind my back. So yesterday I looked in the mirror and she was doing it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't say anything to her? He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My instincts tell me not to. Annie comes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office is phoning, honey. He EXITS SCENE as Anne watches him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope he moves that fast when it's me on the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she passes a chair with an afghan shawl on the back -- she picks it up and wraps it around herself, a bit chilled.  She sees Jennifer on the stairs and moves toward her calling in a too loud, anxiety-ridden voice as she goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer.  Hey, Jennifer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer turning as Jane whips up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget what I said -- you do whatever you want to with him. She pushes at Jennifer a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's nothing I'm going to do right this second. Jane pushes her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's a party, right? Jane smiles back feigning female bonding -- Jennifer goes back down the steps and crosses to Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaron takes in Jane, who is taking in Jennifer and Tom -- then Aaron begins to sense a new dynamic in the room as Ernie re-enters and huddles briefly with Paul... The News President is intent... The two of them walk over to Tom and Jennifer.  We PICK UP just a few words:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This would be a good time to tap that source of yours.  He could have an angle or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is startled but cool -- nods his head -- Jennifer is amazed looking at Tom with new and even prettier eyes... Paul and Ernie now move toward Jane, a whole flow of movement creating a new energy in the area.  Jane sheds her Afghan as she rises to meet them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want you to exec produce a Special Report...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Aaron has come over to join them now in time to HEAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Libyan plane shot up one of our bases in Egypt.  It's all still happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's figure out the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately, since Paul's here, he's made out the assignments... Jennifer at the White House... George at the Pentagon...Martin at State...and we need an anchor since Rorish is in his boat, so we're gonna do the whole report this afternoon from here...with Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.  I resign as of now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what.  I'll stay if Tom knows how to spell Gaddafi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernie, as much as I like you, I think I have to tell Paul what I think, because this is really sort of obscenely stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane, if you want to, go ahead.  I don't disagree with you. Jane moves quickly off, awed at the prospect of taking on the big boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she moves past Tom who is talking on the phone, eventually catching up with Paul.  In the b.g. Tom has just HEARD the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of an ANSWERING MACHINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Buddy.  It's 1:35 -- and this is Tom.  You can reach me at the office.  It's important. I can use a little help. Jane, because of the proximity to Tom is speaking in whispered intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom isn't ready for the job you're about to hand him.  Not near ready.  Not by the longest shot.  Aaron's spent six weeks in Tripoli, he's interviewed Gaddafi -- he reported on the Eight-one story.  I think he's essential to do the job we're capable of and I think it's my responsibility to tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, that's your opinion.  I don't agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not opinion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just absolutely right and I'm absolutely wrong? She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It must be nice to always believe you know better.  To think you're always the smartest person in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's awful.  Oh my, it's awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd better get moving. As they move out... Jane goes to Aaron... He moves with her towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you later -- where you going to watch from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch? -- JANE I'll come by your place, right after...drink, take pills... Love you. She runs out the door.  Aaron turns mean and mocks Jane's last words -- screwing up his face in a savage burlesque.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, love you, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Jane briefly pauses to see which war has room.  Tom opens the passenger seat of his car -- she gets in.  It moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nervous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excited. Jane looks over at him -- there's no question he's just told the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the b.g. we SEE the Bureau Newsroom beginning to pulse with activity.  Tom closes the door.  He sits down behind his desk and opens a bottom drawer -- a clean whit shirt lies there. He opens the center drawer -- two ties are inside.  He picks one.  He reaches for a package of new red suspenders.  He takes off the shirt and puts on the new one -- all of this the work of an expert craftsman.  By the time he finishes he looks like the authority figure we know he's now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane is NOT hyper.  She is purposeful -- organized -- even calming Blair with a little physical contact -- a touch on the arm, to still her colleague's hysterical demons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell George and Jessica to try and cover everything without Tom having to ask additional questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Bobbie says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear what I just said -- do you have that?  Take a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. In the b.g. Tom has exited his office and looks about -- waiting for some indication as to what to do next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the most important thing make sure his earpiece works, have back-ups ready.  That's never been more vital.  He must be able to hear me at every second and clearly. Jane sees him.  She moves across the room -- takes Tom by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have twenty minutes -- you can wait in the studio. Tom coughs nervously into his hand and takes a pen from a nearby desk, clips it into his inside pocket and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane is screening and asking corrections in a graphic representation of an F-14 shooting down a Libyan Air Force Mirage Fighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put in the radar plane that spotted them to begin with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have no pictures on file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't draw -- but this is a rough idea. She uses the stylus from the ELECTRONIC PAINT MACHINE to outline an American Air Force E-2C Hawkeyes Radar Plane.  Her work is stunning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a glass in hand -- some chips on the table with a bottle of wine as he selects a Cassette Desk to play.  He picks a French song -- looks at some of his books.  He might even read.  He is feigning disinterest for an audience of no one. He SINGS ALONG with the RECORD in perfect French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom checking copy in the long hallway leading to the studio -- there is the merest of hubbubs causing him to look up.  Buddy is being stopped at the other end of the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to check first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then check -- but hurry -- There he is!!! Buddy runs the length of the hallway to Tom's aide despite Tom's gestures to slow down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  You didn't have to come here. It's just that I'm going to anchor this special report on this Libyan thing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anchor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, stop!  I wondered if you could find out anything about what's happening. (on Buddy's reaction) What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I broke up with my roommate -- He was really the magnet for everyone who knew anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I can start up with him again if you really...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'm doing fine...Look. Tom stands there -- a man at home in this media castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.  He's on the world's longest ego trip, let him take it alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, okay.  Look Buddy -- I've got to go to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...good-bye then.
direction.name: direction
